vocabulary.definition: a signal sent in an emergency to request help or assistance
vocabulary.example: The sailors on the sinking ship sent out a distress signal to alert nearby vessels.

vocabulary.definition: sets of numbers or symbols that show a particular place on a map or graph
vocabulary.example: The hikers noted down the coordinates of their campsite to easily find their way back.

vocabulary.definition: a journey or voyage undertaken by a group of people with a particular purpose
vocabulary.example: The archaeologists embarked on an expedition to discover ancient ruins in the jungle.

vocabulary.definition: a system that uses sound waves to detect underwater objects or measure water depth
vocabulary.example: The submarine uses sonar technology to navigate through the murky depths of the ocean.

vocabulary.definition: scattered pieces of waste or remains
vocabulary.example: After the storm passed, the beach was covered in debris washed up from the sea.

vocabulary.definition: a visually striking performance or display
vocabulary.example: The fireworks show was a spectacular spectacle that lit up the night sky.
